results.title: Safety in the Kitchen
results.brief_description: Danger areas and high accident risk situations in the kitchen are examined and safe working procedures suggested. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Safety in the home. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and H William Varney
results.brief_description: Demonstrates through a series of brief incidents, the importance of making common sense “decisions of safety” to prevent household mishaps. Includes test situations for children to make correct choices.

results.title: Safety in the home. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the most common safety hazards in the home and how they can be corrected. The film is centred round the story of how a child’s negligence in putting away her toys causes an accident which injures her mother. The incident leads to a thorough check of the household and the removal of other danger spots.

results.title: Safety in the chemistry laboratory
results.brief_description: Professional chemists are shown using safe practices in handling the tools of their trade in the research laboratory. Safety practices are recommended for use in the high school chemistry laboratory. Recommended for schools.

results.title: Safety in offices
results.creator_credit: United States. Navy and Bureau of Aeronautics
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of some of the more common accidents that happen in offices - stumbling over open file drawers, catching fingers in drawers, tipping chairs over backwards, etc. These accidents are presented in a humorous manner but the serious consequences of carelessness are stressed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States. Navy and Bureau of Aeronautics

results.title: Safety in construction. Part 4. Mechanical aids
results.brief_description: Divided into two sections, the first part of this film demonstrates a number of unsafe work sites while the second part shows the acidents that could result when using mechanical aids and how to avoid these accidents.

results.title: Safety in construction. Part 1. Excavations
results.brief_description: Divided into two sections, the first part of this film shows unsafe situations on an excavation site and the second part shows the accidents that could result and outlines how to avoid them.

results.title: Safety in ceramics
results.creator_credit: Moorabbin College of TAFE and K Starbuck
results.brief_description: Introduces basic safety precautions for a ceramic studio when using clay as a creative medium in the classroom. Addresses safety and health hazards inherent in clay dust, the kiln, glazes, electricity and tools.

results.title: Safety II
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
A large number of small children and babies are injured every year in and around the home. These 5 short episodes look at child safety in a practical way. Focuses on issues such as common, easily swallowed poisons, burns, fire-proof clothing, the dangers of electricity, devices which can be installed to prevent electrical accidents, the hazards to be found in the backyard, the safe placement of furniture and fittings in the home, pool safety and rescusitation skills in case of drowning.
